website_summaries.verdict: Though not perfect, the D-Link DIR-857 HD Media Router 3000 makes a great router for homes thanks to its top-notch performance on the 5GHz band and a nice set of features.
pros: The D-Link DIR-857 HD Media Router 3000 offers stellar Wi-Fi performance on the 5GHz frequency band and a nice set of useful features
The router is easy to use and has an effective QoS feature to help fuel HD media streaming, gaming, and VoIP
cons: The D-Link DIR-857 doesn't offer 802.11ac and its performance on the 2.4GHz band is lacking
The router's built-in network storage performance doesn't come close to the speed of USB 3.0

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap and likely defective from the day it arrived
customer_reviews.text: Should have done something about this sooner, I wondered when this unit arrived if it had been previously returned as it appeared to have already been configured and had to be completely reset before I could get it to work. Since then it has been nothing but problems, working intermittently, losing configuration, finally PAID for a technician to come in from my internet provider, they are seeing intermittent 100% packet loss when connected to the router, but NO loss when connected directly to the incoming signal. Total piece of crap and even worse likely something that was defective originally, returned to Amazon and resold as if new! How can a company get away with this!?!?!?
customer_reviews.author: Stuart Trimbath

customer_reviews.title: What does the USB connection do?
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this product to use for expanding my access to the internet from my computers. I noticed that it also included a USB connector. When I connected the input to this router to my modem I was able to use the RJ45 outputs to connect my computers which I was able to connect the internet. I also noted that it had a USB connector on it and connected a spare hard drive to it. I thought that would allow me to access that hard drive that was connected to it. That being the main reason for purchasing this router. I can't fined out what else the USB connection could be used for.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald H.

customer_reviews.title: Very good product - but maybe not for the novice
customer_reviews.text: If your networking needs are modest -- gigabit backbone, and wifi to a few electronic appliances and computers, this is a great product. I pluged it in replacing a DIR-657, and it recognized everything immediately. Subjective network performance went up immediately. However, while I'm very computer literate, I'm no "networking guru", and if you want to "tweak" its performance or security settings, the D-Link interface is still intimidating, a bit cumbersom, and generally not too helpful. Luckily, for me there were only a few things to tweak. Performance - A Plug'n'play - A User interface - B- Documentation - C RECOMMENDED
customer_reviews.author: J. B. Kraft (Died 8-8-2013)

customer_reviews.title: Works great, awkard install
customer_reviews.text: The wireless speed is very good as well as the hard-wired connections. It has two wireless options the fastest option's range is very limited, but it lives up to my expectation. The installation is a bit convoluted if you select "replacing another router". If you don't jump ahead and attempt to install it as most routers, by installing the DVD, and then plugging in the router, and follow each step as the software demands, it gets the job done. But like I said it is much more confusing than installing a Linksys Cisco devise, but the end results are definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I have had extensive use of this product for over a month and I am impressed! It was sticky initially configuring the device. I ended up having to update the firmware on the router before I could get anywhere with configuring the device to work. After that I have no complaints. You can configure this router using your android phone! The app is called QRS Mobile and it works great! I highly recommend this product as it has doubled my internet speed online! I use mostly N-based networked connected devices and one G-based networked connected device with no issues!
customer_reviews.author: Chicago Tripp

customer_reviews.title: Doc
customer_reviews.text: so far this is the best router that I have owned in years. I especially like being able to use SD cards to store small data. The USB 3.0 is very fast and accommodates my NAS disk for network backup. The only small problem I had with the system was that the firmware needed to be updated but that took less than 10 min. and the system has operated perfectly ever since. I am actually running my previous router through one of the gigabit ports. This allows me to have a separate login and password procedure for my family and business.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Mine was used; D-Link does not support this model
customer_reviews.text: I received what looked like a used product. The power cord was wadded together and tied instead of rolled neatly. The wireless channels were already named Snoopy and Garfield. Neither the disc installation wizard, nor the browser wizard could detect an internet connection for some unknown reason. I called D-Link and was told they no longer support this product even if it is under warranty; so no help there. This was not a good experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product but needed the firmware update!
customer_reviews.text: Truly a remarkable product, no lag whatsoever and instant connectivity. Blazing speeds and amazing coverage, no more dead spots in my house. However, when I first installed the router, my old 2005 Windows XP laptop could not connect to the router. After the firmware update, it connected instantaneously! WARNING: MUST DOWNLOAD FIRMWARE UPDATE FROM dlink.com! Instructions are also posted on website under the Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ). Other than that, a fantastic product and I would recommend it to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: Chulamama7

customer_reviews.title: disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have bought D-link for years, never had a problem. I ran the installation CD and it kept reporting I had to cancel and restart and then re-insert the CD. When I did that, process just repeated. Frustrating. So I went into the router settings. I did this because I could access the router as D-link, but when changing names and adding a network password, it would no longer connect. Finally gave up. Too bad. Didn't think it would be this hard.
customer_reviews.author: CinjinSmythe

customer_reviews.title: Wired in
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best router I have had to date. I have gone through several brands including D-Link before this one and they all have lasted a short while. I kept having to reset them. This one I set up one time and have not had to mess with it since. Great wireless reception, excellent band width. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ramrod

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: The router I recieved slowed to a crawl and dropped packets when a modem was attached. Didn't work. The other down side that the whole purpose of purchasing this router was for the HD Fuel which doesn't work if your upload is faster than 2Mb. Thats just not exceptable. So even if it did work I would have returned it because of the HD Fuel limitation.
customer_reviews.author: M. A.

customer_reviews.title: Dlink needs work in their customer service department
customer_reviews.text: Bought this router because of the good reviews. It worked great for about a year then it suddenly dropped one hard wired line out of the three. I spent a great deal of time trying to fix the computer that had the dropped line since none of the other two had a problem. After two calls to tech and about three hours, customer service condemned my ISP's modem. I have had problems with other Dlink products in the past so this will be my last. Better customer service might have saved a customer. I am so far happy with my new Linksys router.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth T. Whitney

customer_reviews.title: Dlink experience
customer_reviews.text: I had been using an older D-Link router in my home to set up a wireless network. I was seek a greater range in the house and 3000 has increased the range to my workshop. Easy to set up also I am not an expert but knowledgeble Have no issues for the past couple of months
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good range
customer_reviews.text: This was to replace and old g unit, the new features are great and the range is much improved. I have a harddrive connected it and it works well. My only problem was a Western Digital media player could not see it as it did not allow me to enter the harddrive address but this was not the routers problem
customer_reviews.author: happy

customer_reviews.title: Fixed my Problem connections
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't get 3 phones, 2 dish hoppers, 3 joeys, a desktop, 2 laptops, 1 tablet, and 1 kindel to consistantly stay connected with my old D-link router. This set up quickly and everything works perfrectly now., with strong signals. What else can I say.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Runs hot
customer_reviews.text: I use and recommend D-Link products for everyone. They have good quality and excellent tech support. This unit has a heat problem in that it runs very hot. Coverage is decent but every once in awhile it drops off and heat is usually the problem. I wish I still had my old Dir-655.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: Great Router, loads of functions and easy to use. The only reason for not giving it 5 stars is for 2 reasons. First if you don't keep the router in an area that has good air flow the unit will heat up and cause a need to reboot the unit on a regular basis. Second is due to the user interface, even when you make a simple change it requires a reboot although they do make it a little better by allowing you to save multiple changes before rebooting which has to be done in order to make changes final.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded from DIR 655, tried Amped Wireless High Power Wireless-N 600mW Smart Repeater and Range Extender (SR10000) but it kept on getting disconnected. Returned the Repeater and went in with the DIR-857. It has been working superbly for multiple laptops, multiple tablets, Apple TV and three PS3. Cannot go wrong with this product, also it is IPV6 ready.
customer_reviews.author: OleXsoul

customer_reviews.title: Awsome perfomance!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This an excellent product. Awsome perfomance, huge range indoors, even trought concrete walls and floors, easy to setup, both band works great as DLink promise to. So far i am very happy with this purchase. I recommend this product 100%
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Lobosco

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Never worked right. Have to reset every day. I got ripped off.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J.

customer_reviews.title: BEST ROUTER YET!!
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Easy setup. Even though I've got it setup in my den, in the basement of my home, the DIR-857's signal covers every square inch of my three story home. Clean sleek design. Works flawlessly! Cons: None to date.
customer_reviews.author: W. Logan

customer_reviews.title: Product broke down in a way that after a year ...
customer_reviews.text: Product broke down in a way that after a year started to loose the signal for wifi and had to reset the modem.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Maldonado

customer_reviews.title: No Instructions, Poor Quality during Setup
customer_reviews.text: There were no instructions included and I could not pull up the router settings online. It was a very frustrating experience.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really unreliable and poor router. Customer service is also poor and will ...
customer_reviews.text: Really unreliable and poor router. Customer service is also poor and will not firmware update anymore. Avoid this brand all together!
customer_reviews.author: David Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great customer Service
customer_reviews.text: I have had this router for 9 months without complaint. After the ninth month it stopped working so I called the help line and Carlos (agent# AR00429) was able to walk me through the steps to get the router back up and running. I am not clear why it stopped working but it now works again and it is as fast as ever!
customer_reviews.author: Greg Becker

customer_reviews.title: Great router
customer_reviews.text: I brought this router is way better than my last one. Even when i use my laptop gaming is now an option on games like league of legends.
customer_reviews.author: luis

customer_reviews.title: Fast Router With Long Range
customer_reviews.text: This thing is fast and has such range that I am streaming from my neighbor across the street ( with permission ) and a $22.00 receiving antenna.
customer_reviews.author: PrettyPicky

customer_reviews.title: Most basic setup, kept dropping connection multiple times per hour
customer_reviews.text: I tried this at my new office, where we already had a wired network ... so I just set this up as a wireless access point (no DHCP turned on). This is about as basic as you can get for a router setup. I connected my MacBookPro to the 2G band, and it was dropping connection multiple times per hour from only 3 feet away. Other folks in our office couldn't connect at all, due to timeouts. I decided to return and go with Linksys.
customer_reviews.author: W. Munro

customer_reviews.title: Solid router
customer_reviews.text: Read about this router on CNET, they recommended it and it seems to be working great, very easy setup. Have it in our basement and haven't had any problems picking up a signal any where in our house.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Halling

customer_reviews.title: If you want your router to lost more than 18months, don't bother with this one!
customer_reviews.text: This router worked for 18months and then just broke. Customer service was useless and made me jump through numerous hoops only to find out that I wasn't covered warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Storke

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Needed help to setup but tech support was very helpful and has been working great ever since.Agent#Ar004211 Rochelle was very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Grace

customer_reviews.title: Not good
customer_reviews.text: My computer guy and myself read about this item and it did not work for us bad investment no use for
customer_reviews.author: kneece

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: D-link makes a terrible router. Don't connect more than a couple devices or it will perform poorly. I would buy anything but this router again.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: D-link router
customer_reviews.text: Very good router. I use it primarily for gaming but fairly consistently I have a laptop, 2 iPads, and multiple devices networked like blu-ray players and what not and the connection is always pretty good. Good investment.
customer_reviews.author: Harold Frelix

customer_reviews.title: could not make it work
customer_reviews.text: and the tech support was non existent...had to send it back. No more D-Link equipment...for me. Still using the old slow linksys..
customer_reviews.author: Robert W. Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Agent ID AR004218 Case C6531974 Great product, and even better customer support from the ...
customer_reviews.text: Agent ID AR004218 Case C6531974 Great product, and even better customer support from the agent above.
customer_reviews.author: Conner

product_meta.title: D-Link Systems HD Media Router 3000 (DIR-857)
product_meta.description:
The HD Media Router 3000 combines industry-leading data transfer rates of up to 900 Mbps with HD Fuel technology to prioritize bandwidth for maximum performance of not only your favorite digital entertainment devices, but all your devices, all at once. The result: incredibly crisp, uninterrupted 1080p HD video streams, seamless, lag-free online gaming, ultra-fast downloads of large media files and uninterrupted Skype calls. And with SharePort Plus USB 3.0 you can connect or stream from any USB device. Unbeatable connectivity and speed, unreal reliability and range – the HD Media Router 3000 stands alone as the most powerful home networking solution ever created. Period.

AMAZON.COM




FROM THE MANUFACTURER


The HD Media Router 3000 combines blazing fast wireless speed--up to 900 Mbps--with HD Fuel automatic bandwidth prioritization for maximum performance of not only your favorite digital entertainment devices, but all your devices, all at once. For gamers and HD movie fans, this router has four Gigabit ports with True Gigabit speed for seamless gaming and videos. You can even access your favorite videos, photos, and music on your iPad, iPhone or Android device from any connected USB drive using D-Link's free SharePort Mobile app. 

The HD Media Router 3000 powered with Amplifi and HD Fuel technologies. 

SharePort enables you to stream to any iPad, iPhone, or Android device via free apps. KEY FEATURES
Speed Get up to 900 Mbps speed--blazing fast connectivity to all of your favorite digital entertainment devices.

Smart Advanced exclusive HD Fuel QoS technology prioritizes high-bandwidth traffic and optimizes your connection for uninterrupted HD video streams, online gaming, and VOIP calls without annoying glitches or lags. Only D-Link HD Media Routers offer this cutting-edge automatic technology.

Simultaneous Dual-band Advantage Maximizes throughput and reduces network interference for seamless HD video streaming and online gaming.

Mobility Free SharePort Mobile app and USB 3.0 port for accessing your videos, music, and files on your iPad, iPhone or Android device from any connected USB device.

Connectivity Four Gigabit ports with industry-exclusive True Gigabit speed for incredible wired network speeds--ideal for gamers and HD movie fans. Plus, an SD card slot enables photo and video sharing across your network--connect however you want.

Simple Setting up your network is as easy as a few clicks in your browser or a few taps on your iPad or iPhone with the with free Quick Router Setup (QRS) app. Add devices at the touch of a button.

Security Create your own network name and password or put it at the tip of your fingers with Push Button Security for advanced WPA/WPS 128-bit data encryption. 
ACCESS FAVORITE VIDEOS, MUSIC, AND PHOTOS WITH SHAREPORT MOBILE
With the free SharePort Mobile app and industry-exclusive USB 3.0 port, you can access your favorite videos, music and photos on a connected USB device wirelessly from your tablet or Smartphone. The friendly interface lets you easily find your files by category, whether you're looking for music, video or documents. With DLNA, the HD Media Router 3000 not only connects to any Ethernet-equipped device, but virtually any device, automatically. 

GIVE YOUR DIGITAL ENTERTAINMENT THE BANDWIDTH IT DESERVES. GIVE IT HD FUEL.
With HD Fuel to automatically manage traffic flow, the HD Media Router 3000 prioritizes your high-bandwidth traffic applications (Netflix, Vudu, XBox 360, VoIP) so that they get the speed they need. Imagine uninterrupted 1080p HD video streams, clear Skype calls, and lag-free online gaming--a clear step up from problems common to "standard" routers. 

D-Link HD Media Routers are the only routers that automatically prioritize bandwidth. With HD Fuel you can even manually prioritize bandwidth by both application and device. HD Fuel is the ultimate traffic management system and best way to stay in complete command of your digital entertainment. 

DUAL BAND = UNLIMITED CONNECTIVITY FOR ALL YOUR DEVICES
Dual-band wireless means you get two networks operating simultaneously (2.4 GHz and 5 GHz), with each network transferring up to 450 Mbps. Surf the Web and check email on the 2.4 GHz band, and run your high definition audio and video digital entertainment center and gaming systems on the clearer 5 GHz band. The 5 GHz band offers less interference from appliances, cordless phones and competing wireless devices.

See larger image. GIGABIT ETHERNET PORTS = UNLIMITED HOME NETWORKING
The HD Media Router 3000 includes four Gigabit Ethernet ports with industry-exclusive True Gigabit technology to ensure that your favorite Ethernet-enabled devices get the most out of their wired connection. HDTVs, the Boxee Box by D-Link, Xbox 360, Blu-Ray Players--connect them all simultaneously. HD Fuel organizes and manages your traffic flow, and True Gigabit technology gives you truly high speeds, so you get seamless 1080p HD video streams and online gaming without annoying glitches or lags.

SHARE YOUR FAVORITE PHOTOS AND VIDEOS ACROSS YOUR NETWORK
An SD card slot is included for quickly sharing HD media files like video. Show your photos, videos, and documents immediately just by inserting your SD card into the slot.

See larger image. SIMPLE SETUP. SERIOUS SECURITY.
You can set up your network from your iPhone or iPad with our free QRS Mobile application. With push-button connectivity and 128-bit security encryption standard, adding devices to your secure home network is as simple as plug and play. The HD Media Router 3000 is Wireless G backwards-compatible. 

Amplifi your wireless home network! The HD Media Router 3000 is optimized for HD video and online gaming.

HD VIDEO
Enjoy the highest dual-band performance available--Stream HD movies and surf the web at the same time--without skipping or lag. With the HD Media Router 3000, you'll also get the highest quality viewing of video content on your HD screens. 

ONLINE GAMING
Stream multiple media content--videos music and more--to multiple devices all at the same time. Now, you can enjoy online gaming with blazing speed--with no lag!

HD Fuel intelligently allocates bandwidth by prioritizing data-intensive applications like HD video, Netflix, online gaming, and Skype calls. 

See larger image. SPECIFICATIONS
 * Standards: IEEE 802.11n, IEEE 802.11g, IEEE 802.11a, IEEE 802.3, IEEE 802.3u, IEEE 802.3ab 
 * Interface and Ports: 4 Gigabit Ethernet ports, 1 WAN port, USB 3.0, 1 SD Card Slot, 1 WPS Push Button 
 * Antenna Type: Internal antennas 
 * Security: WPA-Personal, WPA2-Personal 
 * Firewall Features: Network Address Translation (NAT), Stateful Packet Inspection (SPI), VPN Pass-through 
 * Dimensions: 8.4 x 6.3 x 1.4 inches (LxWxH) 
 * Warranty: 1 year, limited 

WHAT'S IN THE BOX
Router, Ethernet cable, power adapter, CD-ROM with software and documentation, quick start guide



See more
feature_bullets: Speeds Upto 14x Faster than Wireless G
Greater Coverage for Your Entire Home or Office
Intelligent QoS Technology for Superior VoIP and Online Gamin
Connect Computers, Game Consoles, or Media Players to the Web
Gigabit Ports for Incredible Wired Network Speeds
D-Link Green Product (hardware version A3 or later)
Includes SharePort technology for Sharing USB Devices like Printers and Storage over Your Network
